intro: Piper dimorphophyllum, commonly known as the two-form-leaf pepper, is a tropical flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves, which have two different leaf shapes on the same plant—obovate at the base and lanceolate towards the tip. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers that are followed by elliptical, winged fruits. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species, and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant prefers moist, shaded environments and is relatively easy to care for in a humid indoor setting.
